intro: Crocus hatayensis, commonly known as the Hatay crocus, is a species of flowering plant in the Iridaceae family. It is native to Turkey and is characterized by its early blooming period, often appearing in late autumn or early winter. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
